review: I had the salmon and langostino lobster lunch entrée.  It was above average. My customer had the Smithwick's on tap and said it was about the coldest draft beer that he's had in a long time. We sat in the bar and there are plenty of HDTVs around for good sports viewing.

visted Parsippany from MA last weekend, this was right next to our hotel. We went for dinner on Saturday night, and it was pretty good. it has a nice layout inside. the food was decent. about the same quality as any other Friday's location.

price:quality: 4.5/5 raw quality: 3/5 It's a chain in smaller town.  I had low expectations going in, but was very pleased leaving. Service: your typical Fridays/Applebees/Chilis.  Friendly but overworked younger waiter constantly running around.   Atmosphere: typical casual dining Food: they have some  good cooks in the back.  Everything was well executed.  Our table had a MR steak cooked MR, salmon with a perfect grilled sear, and for me - pasta cooked al dente.   There isn't a lot to choose from in the immediate area and the pricing is excellent - so 4/5.  PS - pretty good selection of beer on tap.
Food was awesome drinks were cheap!! Perfect for work lunch and happy hour drinks!!! They even have lunch for like 5 bucks!!! Where can you get a sit down drink and dinner for 5 bucks.

Had a late night meal here after a 4 hour drive.  Dragon fire salmon and chicken Cobb salad for my companion.  Food was very good.  Place is loud with music and active bar with sports TV.  Still a good place to stop for a satisfying meal.  Friendly service.

My kids love TGIFridays, but I just don't think it's as good as I used to (though it a far better than Applebees)...that said, I don't mind stopping in to keep the kids happy.  One of my good friends used to manage this location and when he did this place was one of the best in the area.  Service was great and the food was always consistent.  I can't say that anymore-especially after the other night.  The other problem is that Friday's changed their menu and took things off that both kids loved...it happens, but it was frustrating.  We went here the other night for a little celebration for my daughter and in a half filled restaurant the host wanted to seat us at the table next to the door (it was about 35 degrees)...so we asked for something back where it was warmer.  When our waiter finally found us he took our drink order (one beer, one iced tea, and two Sprites) and our appetizer order (soft pretzels)...then disappeared.  Ten minutes later our drinks made their way to us...but no appetizer.  After another five minutes our waiter took our order...still no appetizer (at least it was free because of a coupon).  Stopped watching the clock and the appetizer came...a good solid 2 minutes before our meals.   I don't understand why a place bothers asking how you want a burger when they all come out well done anyway?  Three burgers ordered medium-all overdone.  All three orders included fries, but the plates arrived with three different amounts on our plates - obvious differences, I wouldn't care if it was a couple fries.   My Jack Daniels burger, which comes with bacon had two tiny, crispy (burnt) half-pieces of bacon.  It was so ridiculous that the waiter came back with an entire plate of bacon.  At least my daughter's fried shrimp was ok...just ok (the shrimp they use are quite small, but they tasted fine).  And, to be fair, the burgers were fine-I like the Jack Daniels Burger. This place was such a disappointment and such a change from when our friend managed it that I don't know if I'll be back anytime soon.  It seems like TGIF is looking for ways to cut costs on their meals and in doing so they probably lost a customer.

Fridays has pretty decent food for a chain and the servers are always friendly. The crispy green beans and Jack Daniels shrimp were quite tasty but the ribs were a bit disappointing. Comfortable booth seating and a great coktail menu.  There are several value menu choices and the portions are huge.  If your goal is to get so big that you need 2 airline seats, Fridays will help you achieve your goal at a reasonable price point.
Keep this in mind next time you order a drink here

This TGI Friday's looked a bit rundown from the outside but my experience inside was above average. Service was very good at lunchtime even though the server was overworked and running around. The food was pretty standard for the chain but at least the chips weren't stale, like I've seen at a few other Friday's locations.

The word of the night "overdone". My mozzarella sticks were puffed up and the cheese was dried out. I ordered my burger with no pink, it came out like a piece of charcoal and it tasted like one too. The fries were over seasoned to point where eating a few caused my chest to burn from the salt. The service was ok but the food was sub par. Revision: the manager came by and asked about our experience and I mentioned the above. She was apologetic and gave us two vouchers for a free appetizer. So at least they tried to make it right.

Came here for first time on a long time since I was a kid and it has changed to the least. The French onion soup wasn't to die for it was more brothy tasting then anything else. The chicken pot stickers are by far my favorite app. The Mac and chz bites were not horrible the bacon definitely helped those out. And as far as burger it wasn't to die for but it wasn't horrible either. Overall the food was I ok better then the past and the service was great Mike was my server and he was good guy so made the night better as it went on. I'll be goin back periodically now and the IF it continue gets better.

Table and booth were spotless. Wait time was 5 minutes for 4 people. The food took a little bit of time to calm but I think it was worth the wait. I ordered the cob salad which was healthy but filling up the same time for one person. Our waiter Alex was very patient and courteous.  Parking was not an issue.
serving dirty water and rubbing alcohol? No thanks, just skip this dirt hole.

TGIFriday's has really been on a downward spiral. Their food is consistently bad. Their service is below average. This location is no different. It's come to a point where even with their delicious Oreo Madness dessert is not enough to have us coming back. A revamped menu didn't even work... Not worth the wait.  Only good thing is their happy hour...good prices...and greasy bad food tastes good when you have some drinks in you!

This is a really bad TGIF. There was a 15 minute wait and open tables everywhere just not cleaned up. The service was bad. Also the food here was kind of gross. The chicken fingers were the worst I've had at TGIF. They were cakey which is really gross.

Wasn't expecting too much. For being dinner time it was empty. Bar was crowded As usual. My food was ok and at first I loved my waiter. He started to disappear though. Never asked if I wanted another glass of wine and while I'm in the middle of eating asked if I was going to have anything else. I figured I'd order my to go dessert since he was around. When it was finally brought out by a runner it wasn't to go. She was quick to  bring it back to go but still no check and no waiter. I finally asked the host to find him or get my check after waiting 20 minutes with purse on my shoulder credit card on the table with keys and the to go bag in my hand. When I finally got the check he didn't apologize for the wait or anything.  I stay at the hampton inn down the street often bit I won't be back.

Food was good... Took an hour to get our appetizer... Then out food came out 2 seconds later.  The waitress was very good and apologetic... The bathroom is absolutely disgusting!  Seriously someone needs to clean up that bathroom.  Tonight I've had a not so cooperating stomache... So that hour waiting for the food I went a few times.  Just nasty.  And please someone fix the paper towel dispenser to allow more than 2 inches to come out.

Been here several times and we have never had any complaints. The place is always clean, the staff is always courteous and the food is always good.  Yesterday, however, we were a little disappointed by our service. We've come to appreciate, at this particular location, that our servers know how to take social cues. Meaning, they take our order, deliver our order, check on us after it's delivered and basically leave us alone until it's time to get the check. It's always made for a comfortable dining experience for two people who like eating their lunch and having a conversation without being interrupted every 5 minutes.  So yesterday, our server greeted us and first asked if we wanted drinks, immediately suggesting alcoholic beverages, which, at 10 minutes to noon, wasn't what we had in mind. We both declined and said we'd both like sodas. We were asked "are you sure?" I found that to be extremely rude but we let it slide. Then she went into the whole specials explanation and went on and on about the new sauces and combos and on and on. I know "corporate" makes the servers push the promos, but if it takes more than 15 seconds to explain them, there's a problem. We just sat there awkwardly listening.  When our food arrived, it was delivered by two friendly gentlemen and our food was absolutely fine. No problems there. Our problem was the fact that we were interrupted by our waitress 4 times while we were eating. It's very annoying being asked how everything is again and again. Once is fine and we will get your attention if we need something otherwise.  When she came back at the end and asked if we wanted dessert, we declined and said we'd just like the check, again, we were asked "are you sure?" Again, this is rude. Yes, we were sure. We didn't want dessert!!  Finally, when she brought us take out boxes for us to pack up our left overs, she was hovering over our table as we were packing up our boxes as she was opening up the plastic bags for us and taking the containers from us and putting them into bags. I mean really? It's a bit much. Overkill comes to mind and was apparent that she was being overly intrusive and eager in hopes to increase the gratuity. Here's a tip.... Less is more. Don't intrude on your customers to the point of annoyance. The gratuity will be much higher, I guarantee it.  Finally, a suggestion to the hostess and management. The booth located at the far end of the higher left level? Maybe that should be used only after the rest of the tables are utilized. You see, it's very uncomfortable, especially when it's quiet in the restaurant, for a customer to be seated directly behind the server station as servers are typing in orders into the micros computer. As if our conversation wasn't interrupted enough by our server, then we had that uncomfortable feeling that our discussion was being overheard by the servers standing in front of their computer every few minutes. Very poor placement. I have no idea why it's laid out like that.  As I said, the food has always been great....much better than other Fridays locations, but service goes a long way in my book, not just quality food.

Well I'll start by stating that I was kicked out of the bar area after we ordered drinks, because one person in our group was 20 years and 8 months old. After I was sent to a table the drinks never came and the server told us we have to show ids again and place the drink order again. My friends and I feel we were picked on just because of our ethnic background. An apology for the misunderstanding from a manager could have made things turn out differently.

I'm only giving one star because I have to. I went here on Saturday night with my friend and my fiancé. We were told the wait would be 15-20 minutes but there was at least 7 tables empty and only 5 parties waiting (all were under 4 people). There was two boys manning the hostess podium, nethier one knew how to do their job. So once we got seated, our waitress came over and she was a mess! She took our drink orders after coming back twice and apologizing for allowing her to pay-out another check. Once she took our drink order, she had to read it back to us twice and came back with one water, when we all asked for one. She came back with our drinks a few 10 minutes later and didn't know which beer was what and we had to taste test to be sure we had the right beers. She then took our meal orders and managed to not "hear" one of the orders. She brought back two out of three meals and never came back to check up on us for 30 minutes! but she kept walking back and forth and never said anything until we were practically finished with out food to acknowledge she forgot to include the third meal. She told her manager and the manager, who also looked a mess, offered us free dessert or to put in his meal with priority. We didn't take either offer. This was the worst experience at Fridays we have ever had and they can be assured, we will NEVER return here.

We should've known this visit wasn't going to go well from outside the door. On a Tuesday night, there were people waiting in the corridor or foyer whatever you want to call it. I figured it was packed for some reason. We walk in a see more people waiting I was like "Wow, they must be giving away food or something"...then I realize that half of the restaurant was empty. In the dining area to the left of the door was about 4 tables full of people, to the right 2 tables of people and the bar area was pretty full. We stand at the podium for about 5 minutes before my fiance went up to the woman who appeared to be the manager and the host and said, "Excuse me, two please"...If he hadn't said that we'd still be sitting there today. "Oh of course sir, what's your name"....yea now you wanna greet us....10 minutes later we were seated. They must've been understaffed or something because probably 60% of the restaurant was completely empty. But wouldn't they put everyone in the same section so that they could use the waiters they did have all in that one area? Whatever. The waitress was fine and the food was typical TGI Fridays food....good enough. But the whole waiting when half the restaurant was free and the rude host and manager just ruined it for me. I'll drive over to rt 10 or down to Willowbrook from now on. Never had a bad experience there.

Typical Friday's. Well kept inside but went for lunch on a Friday with a co-worker. We chose Friday's because we needed to eat and leave within an hour, we thought it would be fast. We made our timeframe, but it was tight. I guess right before we walked in a party of 10 walked in and overwhelmed the restaurant. Our waiter apologized to us numerous times and our longer wait for service and food was because of the large group. I understand this happens, but Friday is a HUGE restaurant and it was nearly empty, I don't understand why everyone was delayed because of this large group. Restaurants like this are supposed to live for large parties like this. Food was just okay.... this is not my favorite chain.

Buddy and I went there around 5 pm on a weekday to get a couple drinks waited almost ten minutes at the bar to get served.  In addition to the poor service and bad staff I asked them a question about how to sign up for the app to get points,  they didn't even know how to do that.  Very bad experience overall

Customer service changes each time i go sometimes good sometimes bad never really great for the amount of money you can definitely get better food the oreo desert is hilarious never get it just one of those oreo cookie ice creams that come in a package. If you want a place that's just okay for a quick decent meal id go to apple bees up 46 east more but this place is okay
Have been twice and each time was so slow. Restaurant empty.. weekday midday, yet every worker seemed to be running around. We still got no service. Will not go back.

I've always liked Friday's, ever since the days when all the servers wore flashing. And I think their food is still very good. So why two stars? Because their upselling is too damned aggressive. Case in point: as a solo business traveler, I was led to my table by a guy who reminded me that "endless apps are back." I told him that as a solo traveller- struggling with weight - I didn't need endless apps. Then the server showed up and said, "I see you've heard about our endless apps" as if in surprise. I told him I didn't want any apps, then ordered a burger. He came back five minutes later to advise me of some apps deal. For the third time in five minutes I had to advise these people I didn't want the apps. So clearly, management has made a big effort to push these apps to the exclusion of all else (including upsetting the customer). I am no fan of the hard sell so much as I like the food, I won't be back any time soon. So Friday's, you eat the f@#ing apps. And for anyone reading this, steel yourself for the sales pitch on this (apparently) high profit item.

went here last night with my parents. I have gone here many times in the past as everyone does. I have always liked this Fridays location. Based on my experience last night, it was just as good if not even better. Our waitress Faye was awesome and hilarious. She took good care of us and made jokes when we couldn't decide. the food came at a quick time and was very good. cant complain about yesterdays experience one bit.
There are way better places to eat in the em area.  Rude service mediocre food and filled with obnoxious people.  I'll pass this place next time

Went here last night for the endless apps as their new marketing campaign actually worked! I sat down with the intention of trying all of the endless apps for all of $12! I had the mozzarella sticks, buffalo wings, French onion dumplings, garlic and basil flatbread and the pot stickers! All I have to say is for a commercialized chain of restaurants they totally revamped their appetizer menu and I highly recommend trying all of them !!

It's a typical chain restaurant. The set up is similar to all TGIF - they have a bar area and the sitting tables area. The bar area is great for the after work drinks.  The food is ok and it's what you would expect of a chain. Last time I was there I got a salmon entree and it was good (again typical chain way).  I like fresh food with unique flavors that's why this restaurant is a 3 star for me.  The service is always good there.

We were a party of 16 including 5 children. We waited 1 hour and 20 minutes for our appetizers to come out. The kids were so ancy and wouldn't sit still. We complained numerous times. Finally the manager came out and we were told that the cook called out today and he had to cook. That's so not right! Isn't there another chef. How horrible. Although the manager was nice and very accommodating the food wasn't all that good and the service was horrific.
Appetizers  are always great. Food comes out quick and servers are always helpful and friendly. Definitely recommend

Appetizers and salad for lunch was actually not bad, Conn salad was huge, loved the pot stickers!  Problem was the service. Everyone was friendly enough, but had an hour before a client meeting, got there just before 1, place wasn't that busy, got our salads at 1:40! I would go again, it is what it is, and location is fine, although a but hard to find on 46!

This location is very close to where I work when in New Jersey, I came in today for lunch and did not know that my lunch would be free because of Veterans Day.  The food is good, basic Americana, the staff at the bar is great.  Thank you Friday's for the recognition of service for all out Veterans.

For such a busy area the service was slow. A drink from the bar took about 20 minutes to come out. John Taffer would not have been very happy. I don't know if it was an off day or what, but I've never had this issue before.

Food was adequate...waiter was horrible.  Brought appetizers to table and asked do you need plates?    Forgot parts of our order and never brought refills when we asked and had to ask again.  Keep in mind there is no one in here as its 12:30pm, so he isn't busy.  When asked to wrap up my meal he put the box on top of my food...$80.00 for crap.

Service was ok.  Food is overpriced.  $15.30 is overpriced for chicken and spinach.  One small Brest and some veggies.  I mentioned service was ok but I've been waiting 20 minutes for my check.  Maybe not so good. I think the east Hanover location is better service wise.

We were out for a small birthday celebration and wanted a place that was about halfway for everyone so we ended up here.  Big Mistake!!  First the waiter was slow. Since they choose not to put their beer prices on the menu (the wine prices are???), the waiter had to find out the price of the beer we were interested in.  That took about 10 minutes.  One of us is on a gluten /dairy free diet so they ordered tomato soup and a salad; no cheese, no croutons.  Well the salad came out fully loaded.  So we sent it back.  This time it came back with no cheese, no croutons and NO tomatoes.  Speaking of Tomatoes, the tomato soup NEVER came...  I ordered the "your call burger". Pretty simple right?  Medium rare, swiss cheese, "roasted" mushrooms and sautéed Jalapenos.  I guess I should have requested a "Fresh" bun as well because the one I got was pretty stale; so much so that the burger almost shot out the back when I bit into it.  The jalapenos were raw and the burger was about 2 stages short of a hockey puck.  When the waiter asked "how is everything?", I told him that the burger bun is stale, the jalapenos were raw and we're still waiting on the tomato soup.  He apologized and left.  Then the manager came over to investigate.  He tried to explain that jalapenos come in whole and they didn't think I wanted whole roasted jalapenos.  I pointed the raw, sliced jalapenos in the ramekin on my plate and asked why they couldn't just grill those a bit.  He just looked at me and said "oh".  He apologized for the stale bun and said they will take the burger off the bill.  When we said we never got the soup he said that he would take that off the bill as well.  Gee, Thanks!  So overall, not a good dining experience.

Never again....onion soup was sour!  The manager came out and said she tasted it and agree.  How does onion soup go sour?. Food prep is not to par...I make onion soup and never ever does it go soup even after 3 days.  Everything else was a disaster..Even a cup of coffee was burned.  I got tired of sending everything back. I actually felt sick after an hour.  Enter at your own risk.  never again.  I am surprised they are still in business.  Only a matter of time.

Friday night went to TGI Friday's in East Hanover, NJ.  Not sure what is going on there but the place was practically empty for 8:00 on a Friday night.  From the time we walked in, to the wait time to get asked for a drink, our order not complete, food not as good as usual, server never came to check on us for drinks, etc., and had to flag down the manager, in passing for the bill.  I've never had that experience there and seems there is a complete turnaround in staff. If that's how it's going to be, no need to return.  I would hate to be there if it was actually busy!

This is the worst Friday's I've ever been to for food-to-go. They over cooked my wings, burnt the potato skins, and messed the order up several times as if I hadn't already been waiting over 20 minutes for an order that was called in ahead of time. When I told the waitress she replied "That's how it is". They didn't even have forks to give. What a ghetto experience. Terrible food, even worse service.

It is ok for a lunch stop.....the food comes out relatively quick.....service is generally good.....the place needs a redo o something.....this is a typical food chain that offers nothing out if the ordinary.
Nothing exceedingly special about this location other than nicer than usual servers and employees when it comes to Jersey.

Service was slow, the medium steak was like eating the bottom of my shoe super tough, tomato / mozzarella salad was so bland all it needed was balsamic. Good Ice Tea and sweet potato fries...never going back.
I had one of the lunch specials, a Caesar Salad and Sliders. The food was great and so was the service. I was here last year for a reunion. I have not been disappointed either time.
Worst dinner I have had in years.  Out here for three weeks and said what the heck try something different.  Horrible steak and cost more than the other places I have been going to.  Never again.

As a former employee of RB (2011-2014) right behind the Fridays, I used to frequent this location many times with former colleagues. After I left the company, this location was the meet up spot with a friend that lives in CT (her parents live in Boonton, NJ). We always had great service in the bar area. Tonight, however, it was absolutely TERRIBLE.  When we arrived, we sat at a usual high top in the bar area. There was about 15 people at the bar and three high top tables: My friend and I at one, a group of 6 next to us and a group of 4 next to them. When we first sat down, our drink order was taken by a young guy with dark boy band hair. After he gave us our drinks, we told him we needed a few more minutes to decide on food. Thirty minutes went by and no one came to take our food order. The table of 6 who were seated after us got their apps before we even ordered. The guy who initially helped us disappeared to take his break it seems. I approached the bar and told one of the young female bartenders that we have been waiting 30 minutes to order and her reply was "Sorry but we have a lot of people at the bar" So either they can't handle their job on a Friday night or Fridays needs to add more experienced help. 10 more minutes went by and another skinny young blond girl took our order. Another 25 minutes went by before our sampler appetizer plate arrived. Upon finishing that, we were so disgusted we got the check.  They were understaffed and the individuals behind the bar during the time we were there between 5pm-6:40pm could not handle it at all. Nice girls but just terrible terrible service. Next time my friend is in town, we will be going elsewhere. I should mention that I personally normally go to the TGI Fridays by Willowbrook Mall which 150 times better.
Slow service at the bar, had to walk over to get my silverware from another table, had to ask twice for a menu, and sat waiting to even be acknowledged for 10 minutes. Very poor service!

We have gone to TFI Fridays for years as our children enjoy the food and atmosphere.  We usually frequent the one in Hanover.  Knowing it's a chain restaurant, not fine dining, we understand what that entails.  However, we went to the Parsippany one on Saturday night at 7pm.  It was not crowded, and that should have been our first warning.  Our waiter was polite but not trained at all and didn't seem to really care.  We only saw him when we looked for him. He was not busy with other tables.   He took our drink orders:  soda, water and a beer-it took 10 minutes to get them despite sitting literally next to the bar.  The sodas came out a few minutes before the beer.  The bar was not busy either.  We ordered simple meals-no appetizers, no special requests.  Our waiter never returned for drink refills or to check on us.  After 30 minutes we found him and he said our food would be right out.  When my simple cheeseburger was placed down, I could tell it had been cooked and then left to warm for a long time.  It was cold to the touch and the cheese had burned and crackled on the top.  I couldn't even cut it with a steak knife it was so overdone (not that the waiter had asked what temperature I wanted the burger).  The fries on the plate were not seasoned with anything. The side house salad I ordered had nothing but lettuce and two chopped pieces of cucumber-no cheese, croutons or breadstick as the menu reads.  When the waiter came back to ask how everything was I very politely said that my burger was overdone.  As he was turning away from the table his reply was "sorry to hear that".  A few minutes later we found the manager, Jasmine.  She took my burger away and offered me something else.  After almost an hour of no food and no confidence that I would get a decent meal, I was done and just asked her to take it off of the bill and she did.  My husband was eating his caesar salad and pulled what looked like a cluster of leaves on a huge stalk from the plate-something that should not be in a salad.  Honestly, it looked like a weed from the backyard.  Again, flagging down our waiter, we gave him no option but asked him to take it off of the check.  My husband ordered a second beer (and he is someone who if the waiter had been attentive would have probably had 4 beers) and it was undrinkable as it was in a pint glass that was not clean.  We gave up and got our check.  My husband and I walked out separately and each of us politely said thank you and goodbye to the two hosts at the front.  They didn't acknowledge either of us.  I will never return to the Parsippany TGIFridays and I think I'm pretty well disgusted with the chain in general now.  Very disappointing.

Worst customer service and food ever. Ordered lunch today to go and found paper in the container. Manager had nothing to say other than it is unacceptable. I wasn't offered any compensation except we can make it again for you but I would still be charged and had to wait another 20 minutes for it to be made. I do not trust their food preparation. Eat at your own risk. I recommend going elsewhere.

I used to enjoy Friday's.  I like the Jack Daniel's sauce, but ordering the flat iron is stupid because of the price and it's Friday's.   I stick with the burger, and I've been satisfied in the past, though I've suspected a decrease in quality at this location recently.  Today my fears have proven right.  It's Sunday afternoon, and empty.  It took forever to get our food (2 burgers).  I ordered broccoli in lieu of fries.  I got both by accident.   The burger was good.  The bun was not.   Hard in places and tasted funny.   I had to eat the burger with a knife and fork (!).  The fries were freaking  disgusting.   Cold and without taste, like my ex-mother-in-law.  I'm glad I had ordered the broccoli, though I felt bad for the SO. This may be all Friday's, I'm not sure, but it seems like a bar with an option of food now.   The menu is mostly drinks. Maybe that's why?  We've eaten at the Friday's on 22 in Union? I guess? and the one in Clifton right off 3, and they haven't taken the dismal turn this one has.   So disappointed. Bleeeeech.

I don't know why the management of this restaurant just doesn't seem to be able "to get it!" If you glance through the reviews that are critical, you'll see that a rather common theme is "poor service."  I used to frequent the place quite often but, beginning about four years ago, I detected a sharp drop off. First it was just with the service but it eventually became an issue with the quality of the food as well. I complained. Apologies were given, and I returned. But less and less often. In the past year and a half or so, we've been dining there more often because it seemed like they'd taken on some cooks who knew how to properly prepare the food, and service got noticeably better. Until tonight, that is. For starters, the place was far from busy when we arrived. I didn't do a nose count, but I'm sure the manager's check of the register will show that my assessment is correct. We ordered two drinks, and told the server we would give her our order by the time the drinks were delivered.. When she didn't return in ten minutes or so, we hailed a passing server and asked him what had happened to her. He said that he'd let her know we were ready to order. When she arrived some three (or more) minutes later, neither one of the drinks were what had been ordered. I could live with mine, so I accepted it, but my guest wanted her drink on the rocks (and not mixed), so it had to be returned. About five minutes later, the server returned with the drink. Without the lemon that had specifically been requested that is. When we asked her questions about some of the items we were interested in, her response generally was, "I don't know, I'll have to check." We eventually decided on two of the items on the menu and placed our orders. Once again she left, and once again we were left waiting. We saw guests who arrived after us (and had different servers) getting their meals while we just sat and waited. And waited some more. So once again, after sitting there for an additional ten minutes or so,  we had to hail a passing server and ask him if our server had perhaps gone home because she wasn't feeling well. He again said that he'd have her see to it that our meals were delivered. When she arrived about ten minutes later, she told us that she had delivered the dishes we'd ordered to another table! I find it hard to believe that two people at another table had ordered exactly the same thing we had. I suspect that they, too, had been sitting there for close to a half hour as well, and were prepared to take anything that was put on the table. When the manager arrived, we were old the same old story that  the server had given us. Not an apology, mind you, but some mumbling about the fact that some of the staff hadn't shown up. Not that the number of guests called for more staff, mind you, but apparently any excuse is better than none at all, right? We cancelled the food order. The manager offered some sort of a discount coupon that  could be used at the time of our next visit. My advice to the manger is this: first, hire some competent people. Then properly train and supervise them. Finally, don't hold your breath, thinking that we're about to come rushing back soon! There are a lot of restaurants out there, and the goal of going out for dinner is not to come home with an empty stomach and a pounding headache! .
Ok food chain! Food is not bad! Beer selection is better the Applebee's!!! Over my experience here all been positive! Don't mind coming in once in a blue moon!!!

The bartenders are great! They all work hard, friendly, and get the job done. I've never had a bad experience with them. However, the beer on draft is terrible. It's either not cold enough or its flat. They have specials on draft but it seems like they're forcing you to drink bottles bc it's more expensive. The food is already crazy expensive for not so good quality food. Now I have to spend more money of bottle beer bc the draft system is terrible.

Mixed reviews about this location.  At time the food and service seems acceptable and other times it just terrible.  I live near by and usually go local when dinning out.  On my last visit the service was not the best and the food was over cooked.  We didn't have time to send the food back as we didn't have too much time for lunch.  We reported the issues and we didn't get the proper response.  Most chains alert their manager to see what can be done, but at this location the manager never checked in with and the waiter disappeared.  My wide and I will not be back for while until we see better reviews. My advice to the staff and management is be overly attentive to your customers.  Checkin every 10 to 15 min.  It's that simple and remember to refill the drinks when they are low.  The customer should not point that out.

These reviews don't lie.  Our waiter was greater but I think there's a management problem here. We get there & there about I would say 30 open tables (15 in front & another 15 on side leading to the bathrooms) .  The lady in front says probably a 10-15 wait for a table.  I said are you kidding me? There are so many open tables? She said yes but we literally have no one to serve you. Have to wait. My wife said her steak was wack, so probably not going back. It's ashame... One of my favorite honey mustards growing up.

I should have listened to the reviews! However it was Fridays or my hotel restaurant two days in a row. I should have stuck to the hotel....While the bartender acknowledged me quickly-once my order was placed I never heard from him again. Others brought my food. The broccoli cheese soup (which back in the day was yummy) looked like cream colored water with 2 chunks of broccoli. I took two bites and slid it to the end of the bar. I ordered chicken which came with a side of tomato mozzarella salad. I love tomatoes and mozzarella. The only problem was that there was NO MOZZARELLA! All that was on the plate were tomatoes and 2 strips of basil. I haven't been to a Friday's in awhile so I'm not sure if it had all gone downhill of if its just the location. But please, avoid this location and save yourself. BTW I'm still sitting here as I type this and the bartender hasn't looked in my direction. My food has been pushed to the side and my glass empty going on a half an hour.....

I came in as the place was winding down from the dinner rush, and seemed like there really wasn't much rush at all. I ordered the pick 3 appetizers and got pot stickers, boneless wings, and pretzels. The pretzels were good but the cheese that came with it was hard and barely warm, the pot stickers were good, and the wings were average and skimpy with the sauce. I have had better experiences here, but most every time the service is somewhat lacking, with the food being just average.

This place is looking run down - we sat at the bar area and there was fruit flies all over the table next to ours and it stunk dirty. My chipotle salad was good and chicken wings were a tad bit greasy . Will probably not be coming back to this location :(
I tried to grab a bite.  I was considerate and knew it was late but was shut down.  Couldn't even get a menu at 10:30.

The worst service don't go unless you have three hours to waist waiting for only appetizers desserts and non alcoholic drinks. Bring your own plates too unless you want to eat appetizers on the table.Snail pace wait staff who couldn't seem to get a party of four their two waters one soda and ice tea right. Recieved dessert before appetizers told them nuts on side it was covered in nuts and once again no plates. Did I mention we went at five o'clock ! The place was empty three hours to get three appetizers two desserts. Unbelievable don't go!!!
On a snowy Saturday with a very light lunch crowd, we suffered a very long wait to receive our cold burgers and fries on 3 day old stale buns.

Avoid this place! My fiancé and I came here to watch the playoff game and the place was empty... on a Sunday.. during playoffs. Now I know why! It took 15 mins to get our drinks. The bartender under-poured each drink right in front of us and just added more ice. The food was burned. And we sat for 10 mins with empty drinks while the bartenders talked to each other on the other side of the bar.

Trying to watch the NFC championship game. And I got bone thugs and harmony blasting in the background over the speakers. Wings were rock hard. Mozzarella sticks were gross. And bud light was bitter so switched to Coors light, that was bitter to. Bartender was nice and all the staff I ran in to so not knocking them. I like TGIF but this one sucks.

We made reservations for 7:45 on Saturday night via Open Table because with 2 kids, we don't like to wait too long. We arrived at 7:40 to be told they are no longer sitting people.  We ask for the manager who comes out to say she's sorry but the kitchen is backed up.  The entire right side of the restaurant is empty but all the people waiting were told to leave. There were 20+ people who left and more people pulling into the parking lot. Can't make any comments about the food since we didn't eat there.

Things have changed here.  The overall pace is slow.  From getting seated to getting a drink order to receiving the drinks to placing a lunch order and getting the food was over an hour.  Our server  who was supper nice and gracious blamed it on the computer system.  They are short handed help wise and no real sign of a management with any leadership.  The food met expectations for a chain.  In the end they paid for our lunch even when we insisted on paying.  Unless there there are systematic  changes here at TGIF I would say there days are numbered.

I've been here a couple of times for endless apps. The deal is pretty good, but that's pretty much it. Food is just okay. Also got to try their black bean burger + mac & cheese. It wasn't anything special. Service was good, and there was plenty of parking, which is always a plus. Honestly speaking, I'd rather go to Applebee's for half apps.

On March 4th, 2017, I was looking into eating out and eating a good steak. Based on my research, I happened to find TGI Fridays, so I asked my father how was his overall dining experience there and it was not good at all. Even though he recommended me not to go there, I went against his own recommendation and boy should I have taken his advice! Since I went to the one in Clifton, I had a so-so experience, I've decided to give the TGI franchise a second chance, so I drove all the way to Parsippany. As I am arriving to this TGI Fridays, I realize how unique it is to have it on a more elevated area in Route 46 West, and it stood out much more than other TGI Fridays that I have seen. To start things off, the location, atmosphere, steak and fries were great! On the other hand, those were the only positive outcomes of this experience that I've had. Like any other restaurant, our waitress started us off with some drinks. Me and a friend of mine ordered the strawberry lemonade, and it was okay (not great or awful). Wait time to get lemonade? Approximately 30 minutes. Next, when I finished the icy lemonade, I asked if I can have a refill and it would take an additional 10 minutes for it to arrive by another person that is not even our waitress. Oh, and it was pretty empty for a Saturday night. At this point, my patience began to dim. The saliva flow was building up profusely, and it would be another 15 minutes, until we received our appetizers (mozzarella sticks and boneless BBQ wings). The boneless wings came out to be spicy the first time, not BBQ. After the mistake, the waitress brought BBQ wings and it lacked my expectations. It tasted as if it were still uncooked. Whereas, the mozzarella sticks tasted as if they put a piece of cheese in between two loafs of bread, melted cheese on top, rolled it up, and called it "mozzarella sticks". The steak has yet to arrive and it has been over 70 minutes. By this time, we already ate three rounds of each appetizer, primarily due to hunger, and she was offering another round, but I wanted the NY strip that I was craving. After approximately 110 minutes (1 hour and 50 minutes) the waitress passes by again to ask how are we doing. I asked her about how much longer is it going to take for our steaks to arrive. As she saw the discontented looks that both of us had, she went to check and in less than 3 minutes, it finally arrived. When I saw how she immediately went to attain our steaks after our faces of discontent, and deliver it to us, this really disappointed me. Mind I tell all the fellow Yelpers and people who are reading this review, I have asked a couple of times before how long until we get our steaks and she said that it would be coming out soon. The steaks and fries were the last positive outcomes of this dining experience. The Jack Daniels sauce that they added was delicious and the fries were good. Later on, we skipped the deserts, because our tanks were finally full. Finally, yet importantly, the bill for the dining experience. $79.20 for the horrible dining experience that we'd have to endure, without even including the tip on the bill. This is the second and last time that I am going to a TGI Fridays facility. I do not even blame the waitress. Moreover, the administration deserves most of the blame. There is absolutely no excuse for the lack of customer service, and it is highly intolerable for a restaurant to provide two customers two steaks almost two hours after they ordered it with only a little more than half of the restaurant being full on a Saturday night. I will be taking my business somewhere else.
Stopped in to grab a drink and endless apps. Service was slower than expected but it was mildly busy. My fried pickles were decent. Pot stickers were good. And Jack chicken was goid.

Have been coming here fairly regularly for years for good apps and good service at the bar. Have to say though that in the last few months the service at the bar has dropped off dramatically. The bartenders are still very polite and have a smile on their face but the level of attentiveness is well below the norm. Some nights it appears to be because they are too busy with service and the hightops. Other nights it appears that there is too much sidework going on.  Either way it adds up to a subpar experience.  Kudos to the kitchen though for keeping the food consistent.  A year later and service at the bar is still terrible. Bar staff is unable or unwilling to ever look up while performing tasks.  Someone needs to let them know that you can pour a draft beer and take a quick glance at your customers at the same time. There were 3 bartenders behind the bar and there was never more than a dozen customers at the bar and two or three hightops yet we all waited for drinks and food orders. The barmaid that took our second drink order had to ask us what our first round was because it was never put in the system. Bad sign.  Another barmaid yelled over to one of the hightops to get their drink order and then placed the drinks on the bar for them to pickup. Another bad sign considering they were just not that busy.

At bar eating fairly decent mahi mahi  Have a drink and it's been 13 minutes now since I finished my last drink and nobody's asked me if I need another barmaid  nonexistent talking to customers Pathetic  Most TGIF's are like this barmaids are too friendly with customers talk too long take away service from other customers
Relatively good food, although it leans towards the spicy side, and service that varies from mediocre to outright grand depending on your server. .
Great food. Service was quick and friendly. Jessica our server was lots of fun. Everyone really enjoyed what we ordered.
Very clean, nice atmosphere, friendly staff. Just way too loud. They need to discard the multiple TV's and turn down the music.

Wonderful meal. Had the Jack Daniels Sirloin and it was yummy. I asked for it rare and it was spot on for how I like it. My wife ordered the same Sirloin cooked Medium and it was exactly right. Our server, Lily was great, very attentive, very calm, wasn't pushy to clear the table, let us sit and relax and take our time.
Horrible service and equally poor quality food.   Waited one-hour for a cheeseburger and fries as stale as cardboard.  This place has been going downhill for past 4-months.

We had to wait for an hour for the food to come. We didn't get the food until I asked to speak to a manager we ordered Chicken wings, 2 buffalo burgers, chicken with pasta and when the food came it was cold.  The waitress Elizabeth kept coming and apologizing to us. I felt so bad for her. This was the worst service from the kitchen. We will never come back here again.

Stopped here after work because wasn't in the mood to sit in rush hour traffic. Honestly though due to the service here traffic sounded appealing by the time we were finished eating.  We received our appetizers and dinner before we received our non-alcoholic drink. The chicken strips in the appetizer were dry and didn't have enough sauce. The food wasn't the regular of the chain restaurant.  To be honest, the food wasn't that terrible but the wait staff was rude and made the whole experience not worth visiting this location again.  Not worth the time or the effort, or money, stay in traffic!
This is my every Sunday night stop. This place will not be the same when Henny leaves. Always amazing service with her and delicious food
No keg beer, got bottle beer that was old. Server had no idea what a cider was. The place is empty and I know why. Not good :(
Kitchen has been incredibly slow the last few times I've come here. Was much better 5 years ago.

First time to a Fridays in years.  This place is right on!  Had a southern fried chicken sandwich which was terrific, and chose steamed broccoli which was fresh, tender florettes in a nice, light butter and lemon sauce. Perfect.  Mr F was our server. Delightful guy warm and welcoming. Definitely will return.
The food was good but the server took forever to bring the food and he forgot what we need it!

This is the second time I have ordered food to-go from here.  Both times the orders were wrong.  Jack Daniels burger was missing the Jack Daniels sauce.  My meal was missing the sides.  The wrong sauce came with my appetizer.  The first time I thought it was just a mistake.  After this second wrong order I won't be returning.

This place is the epitome of bad service. Starts with no hostess to greet customers arriving. We waited 10 minutes to put food order in then were abandoned. We walked out after waiting 30 minutes for food. The place wasn't even busy! Folks in the table behind us left too! Their food arrived really late & cold. They repeatedly asked for the manager to no avail. This place is missing the mark on so many levels. Avoid the aggravation. Eat elsewhere.

Don't get the endless apps! They are horrible! Poor quality food. Portions are very small n takes forever for next one to come. Nachos are not typical. Quesadillas tasted weird. Pot stickers gross. Buffalo wings were ok. Aside from that.. French onion soup tasted watered down. Cheese was cheap brand. Uuuugh

The slowest service i have ever seen....was there an hour and half before we received any of our food...granted we were a party of 11 but still the place was empty....we finally had to get a manager to get all of our food out because it was taking wayyy too long and with 5 kids with us....it was wayy too long for them to sit there....we were finally out of there after 2 1/2 hours...

Horrible experience, will never step foot in this restaurant again. Service is extremely slow, the bartender kept dropping things left and right because he was rushing around. Nothing good to say about this place.

This was the biggest disaster I have ever witnessed! We came in for dinner, drinks and to watch the hockey game. The bartenders were clueless and kept dropping things, breaking bottles and when the shaker fell on the floor, Roxy picked it up without washing it! Gross!! Our food was so disgusting, cold and our dirty plates stayed on the bar in front of us for an hour. The manager comped our food and looked completely overwhelmed because everyone was complaining. The bathrooms were disgusting too! Roxy acted inappropriate with some of the patrons and everyone at the bar was fed up with the service. We got an uber to Houlihans down the road and it was as terrific there! Houlihans is clean, bathrooms clean and the service was excellent. Avoid TGiF!!!

I'm giving 1 start because there is no 0 stars... we went there for a happy hour after work... arrived at 5:15 and there were max 20 people (it was still early), we ordered our drinks, and 15 minutes later our "server" (if we can call this individual one) showed up saying that they were out of half of our drinks, but she brought 2 "extra waters" (we were 6 and no one else had water), so we ordered something else. a few minutes later she shows to our table again saying "I just put your drink order and it should be out soon"... wait a minute, you just put in an order that we placed 30 minutes ago?... we continue to patiently wait for our drinks, and can see they are served at the bar, but this lady is no where to be seen. My boss walked to the bar and asked, and then still took a while for the "server" to bring our drinks. It was 5:55 when the drinks mande it to our table; off course we were upset... oh and the other 4 waters that we had ordered earlier never made it. We decided not to order any food as everything is as slow as can be. We asked for our check (my boss did) and oh surprise, she brought it right out... at last something fast, but it then got ruined again, when she made her way half way through our table at least 4 times, but went back for other things. My boss was literarily waiting 15 minutes holding the little booklet before she came to get it. Needless to say the $1.0 tip we left  as very generous.  Never going back.

Came here yesterday since my friend I and forgot to make a reservation at Zinburger and it was packed with a wait of 1.5hrs!!!!  When we got here, the place was practically empty,  which was stranger for 8pm on a Saturday night!!!  Let me tell you, if you walk into a restaurant that empty on a Saturday night...THERES A REASON!!!!  I got a cheeseburger, my friend the southern chicken sandwich.  When the food came out,  my burger and fries were Luke warm, and my friend's chicken was over cooked, it looked burnt. She also said it was luke warm.  My sangeria was gross, and super sweet..how do you screw that up? I only gave 3 stars because the waitress was super nice and attentive.   Eh, I wouldn't recommend this place, it has 2.5 star rating for a reason.

Terrible. Service at bar was so bad. Ordered new item, Bucket of bones. Ribs were the toughest I have ever had. Pretty sure they were microwaved. Asked for blue cheese for wings, never got it. Fries were drenched in buffalo sauce which is bad because they typically have good fries. All came in one bowl, had to put bones on a napkin. Service was non existent, never asked how my half eaten meal was and I almost threw cash on counter as I could not continue to wait. I don't think I can come back.

"This place is home of literally my top five worst dining experiences ever" - this was saved in my drafts from the last time I had the misfortune of coming to eat here. Tonight against my better judgement I was convinced to come here for late night snacks and drinks with my girlfriend. We were seated as normal only to find when it came time to order drinks that the bar was closed. With three hours left before the building would close. The scheduled bartender had to leave and They had no one else trained to serve the drinks and therefore closed the bar. Literally the one reason I was willing to go was because of the drinks. Dumbfounded and shocked beyond belief, we decided to leave... the only saving grace of this entire evening was that we hadn't ordered food yet and were able to leave with no hassle. I find it very hard to believe that no one in the entire restaurant staff tonight was trained to serve the drinks, no managers or supervisors had this training? I'm shocked!

We stopped in because we were in the area and it was close. I remember coming here before and having an OK meal so we gave it a shot. I used to go to Friday's on occasion but it's been a few years. We ordered the queso dip and fried green beans only to be told five minutes later they were out of the dip. We got the pretzels instead. Appetizers came out quickly. They pretzels were nice and soft and well salted. The cheese dip for them was fine except it looked like someone dropped a half cooked piece of bacon into the bowl. I wasn't sure what was up with that so I pulled it out to the side. Green bean fries were as I remembered from the last time I went, pretty good. We both ordered burgers, medium rare. Mine came out well done (ugh) and the other came out pretty rare (it almost looked neon pink inside). The fries were unevenly cooked and a little soggy. This pretty much confirms that all they do back there is microwave things and mess up the one thing they have to cook, burger meat. I think I've been to better Fridays locations to say the least but this has definitely put me off the chain for another five years.

The wait for our waitress was a tad lengthy but once our waitress came, everything was great! The attention from Monique (our waitress) and the manager who made her way around to every table and who brought me fresh fries made us want to add this in our lunchtime rotation

First time at the Parsippany NJ location Our company just moved into Parsippany and we don't know any restaurants in the area therefore it was comforting to notice a Friday's down the street. We arrived at 1pm (a late lunch) and the top row was busy with only 1 waitress. The service was good (Monique was very efficient & pleasant given she was busy). My portion of my meal was a little sparce compared to the same meal I ordered a week prior in the Princeton location. The quality of food was excellent though - it was very good. The same holds true for my friend who enjoyed her mean as well. We received our lunches in a timely manner and we were greeted by the waitress as well as the Manager a few times throughout the meal, making sure everything was fine, which is was. Overall, we will be back and I look forward to trying a burger there. Good job but not quite great ... yet! I have hope though.

Do not come here. Just don't. Horrible I mean horrible service. The manager Eduardo was the worst. I asked to speak to him and the server came back and said he was to busy to talk. I am beyond annoyed and would never come back here. Service took forever for just water. Everything took forever to come.

What happened to Parsippany Fridays where staff greeted you, opened the doors, the restaurant was hopping and bartenders professional and excellent.  Now, the service is atrocious, bartenders are literally bottom of the barrel in both skills, attentiveness  and cleanliness.  Staff is unable to get a to go order ready in the 15 minute timeframe that they give you. You then have to go to the bar to pick it up, stand there and be ignored and finally, usually in about 30 to 40 minutes, your order comes out.  Tonight my salmon contained fish skin and scales..was told cook forgot to take it off.  I brought it back, received apologies and got new dinners. Got home again only to find that the fish was barely cooked and mostly raw. I think I am done with Fridays......shame, it used to be such a great, wonderfully run restaurant.
